reviewText:
Early Access Review

Beat your new zombie collegues with paperballs"
Super hilarious roguelike isometric action RPG.
Imagine it's your first day in a company. You walk around and suddenly some of your collegues turn into zombies. In the beginning your only weapon are paperballs. Coffee makes you going faster and herbal tea reduces your stress level. You get more stress if you are hit by zombies. And waterspenders are your savepoints. Hilarious: speak to your "normal" collegues and you will see how calm they are. They are so deep into work that they don't even freakout in a zombicalypse. Additional you earn each minutes 10 USD salary. Use it on vendor machines to buy grenades and powerups. Climb up the career ladder
recommended: finish some side quests and you will beat this game sometime. I also liked the soundtrack very much."
votesHelpful: 13 of 16 people (81%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A fun game to waste some time with, while it's not particularly deep or innovative, killing zombies is always one of my favorite past times.

The game has a few issues, and would probably be far better with some working controller support.  The K & M are ok for the time being though.

The humor is kind of hit or miss, but ultimately the game is cheap and relatively fun to play.  Will be nice to see what new features or improvements the developer makes once he's able to get back to improving the game..

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I instantly fell in love with this game - Zelda set in an office with Zombies.

The dialogue is hilarious and the company where the story is set reminds me of my last job on a Monday morning.
Even in Early Access there appears to be a great deal of content. The levels are large and there are plenty of items and side-quests.

One thing that would make this game better is controller support but coming from an MMO background I don't mind using WASD and using the mouse to click on icons.

Good job

reviewText:
Early Access Review

PROS:
+Casual
+Zombies in an office theme
+Humorous dialogue
+Creative (Stress level is HP, save point is water dispenser)

CONS:
-Gameplay mechanics are very basic and repetitive
-Story is one-dimensional and unengaging
-Needs better sounds

Verdict:
It’s a great start for a small and inexperienced Indie team of 1 or 3. The base gameplay is too outdated and could use a lot of added features. Not even adding more to the story or more quests, etc. will make this game more fun; it is bland and too simple. Does a great job capturing the theme of Zombies in an Office workplace.
This is not the kind of game I’d play in my free time, but it’s a great example game to put in one’s game design portfolio.

Early Access Review

Fun game so far, intersting mix of RPG and action. It has huge potential and the developer is very receptive to feedback.

The new controls make the game much more playable, and it's fun to navigate around the office, pushing chairs in the way of zombies, setting up barricades and mines etc. The dialogue is hilarious. In many RPG's going through dialogue can be a chore, but here it's great and makes me want to initiate conversation with all the NPCs.

I'm currently not a fan of the way zombies spawn, and there are a few little niggles like collisions that aren't perfect.

I would highly recommend downloading this game and leaving detailed feedback to the developer, as the gameplay gets much more refined with each update.

Early Access Review

The gameplay is really fun with relaxing music, and the control is fixed already, so it's worthy to its price anyway tho !
Recommend 8.5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I like idea and look but it feel very early acces

- horrible controls, not very polished inventory or vending machine screen
- not much variety in enemies, different size or speed and that's preety much that
- there is not much to do after a while, there are like 2 main weapons, decoy, 2 mines, barricade and some consumables, like 15 items total + couple wearable that give different stats
- zombies are spawning very random and near player - you runing from bunch of zombies I just spawn one or two on your way and kill you because why not
- colisons boxes seems like taking whole sprite of character so it is harder than it should be to avoid enemies in tighter areas and feel clunky and wrong
- No map or quest direction and levels are very repetive and made from couple tiles so it is easy to get lost

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I spend all day tossing paper balls in an office full of zombies. I then come home and play this.

10/10 office simulator.

EDIT:
The update for aiming and shooting with the mouse is probably the best update you could do with this game.

I've not read them, but I bet most of the bad reviews are complaining about not being able to aim with the mouse, which has been addressed now. Don't let them put you off buying the game.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is an allegory and I love that about it! xD If you come in contact with a fellow co-worker-turned-zombie, you gain more stress. If you gain enough stress, you turn into a zombie and you lose. Advance as long as you can and defend yourself by throwing paper balls. The average working man and/or woman would be able to appriciate this game because its simplicity and humor and overall solid design. The theme is relevant and the game itself is fun! A solid purchase for sure!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Changed my mindInteresting concept. Horrible execution.
Very clunky targeting, no excuse why it should be this ♥♥♥♥♥.
Holding a special key to toggle your aim one direction while moving in another, but all of your visual cues are wrong.

Other games do zombie crap better.

The developers are listening to feedback. And they're decidedly nice about it. My main issue was with the controls and lack of visual cues. They modified the controls and it's significantly more familiar, enabling one to step into the roll of office peon with minimal fuss.
The item system hints at fun future possibilities for office warfare.
The quests tasks are relatively straightforward. They're even working on some laidback humour.

The difference between the first play and the second play are night and day, and I am rather enamored with the game now.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Dec 24th: Controls are improved over the previous iteration. Mouse aiming and moving with the keyboard is far easier.

Pros:    Very easy to get trapped by zombies
Funny dialogue with coworkers
Ability to block zombies with office furniture
Clothing makes the man - parody clothes with bonuses
Barricades are a nice touch for damage + blocking
Office styled consumables - coffee, herbal tea, CDs, paper balls
Good base tutorial
Recycling machine with hidden recipes
Cons:    Spawning is hard to get used to, clear a hallway and seconds later, zombies spawn there
Lack of explanation of stats - popularity does what?
Mines damage the player - probably obvious but it was a hard lesson at first
Setting mines and barricades are set in your pointed direction, not under your mouse. Makes for odd placement and handling at first go.
Graphic options are limited
Edit: Stats have been posted in the forum.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty good game!

I was struggling at the start to find ammo and health but midway through the basement I was well stocked with DVDs and Mineral Water. Favourite weapon is the mine. Although I just picked up some paperclips which are quite handy. Think that the spawning can be a bit annoying sometimes if you have low health and you duck round a corner or behind an obstacle only a for a zombie to spawn in front of you.

There's an awesome boss battle when you make it to the carpark... thats about as far as I've got so far.. I hope there is more suprises in store :)

Support for a gamepad would be cool.
